All Classes

Class Description
Action
Base class for Actions.
ActionList
A thin wrapper for java.util.ArrayList<Action> that does not allow nulls to be added.
Actor
An entity that is alive by having hit points.
ActorLocationsIterator
Represents a bimap of locations and actors.
Application  
Application  
Application
The main class for the Mario World game.
AttackAction
Special Action for attacking other Actors.
AttackBehaviour
A behaviour which will be provided to an actor so that actor can automatically attack its target, which is Player for now
Behaviour
Interface for behaviour to be followed by non-player actor
Bottle
Bottle class that can be used to fill and store unlimited amount of water
Bowser
Class representing Bowser

BuyableItem
Interface for item that can be bought
CapabilitySet
A collection of Capability objects.
Capable
An interface for representing a collection of any kind of enum.
Coin
Coin object that can be picked up by actors to add into their wallet balance.
ConsumableItem
Abstract class representing all the items that can be consumed
ConsumeItemAction
Action for consuming consumable items

DemoCapabilities  
DestroyShellAction
This action represents the action of actors destroying Koopa's shell after Koopa entered dormant state
Dirt
A class that represents bare dirt.
Display
Class that manages I/O for the system
DoNothingAction
An Action that doesn't do anything.
Drinkable
Interface for all grounds have water and are drinkable
DrinkableManager
Drinkable manager to manages all the drinkable ground
DrinkBehaviour
A behaviours which allows enemy to drink water and obtain the corresponding effect from drinkable ground
DropItemAction
Special Action that allows Actors to drop items.
Enemy
Abstract class for Enemies that automatically attack players when in range and follow players after engaged in a fight
Exit
Class that represents a route from one Location to another.
FancyGroundFactory
Class that can create different types of Ground based on the character that represents it.
Fertile
The Fertile interface needs to be implemented by the ground type that are classified as fertile ground
FertileManager
Fertile Manager is a class that is responsible for maintaining all the instance that implemented the Fertile interface
Fire
A Fire would be dropped upon a Fire Attack that burns anyone for 20 damage.
FireFlower
Fire flower
Floor  
Floor  
Floor
A class that represents the floor inside a building.
FlyingKoopa
Class representing a Flying Koopa.
FollowBehaviour
A class that figures out a MoveAction that will move the actor one step closer to a target Actor.
Fountain
Abstract class fountain which contains water that will give effect upon consuming
GameMap
Class representing one map within the system.
Goomba
A little fungus guy.
Ground
Class representing terrain type
GroundFactory
Interface for factory classes used by GameMap to create new map locations.
GrowCapable
An interface called GrowCapable that provides the ability of growing into the next stages
HealingWater
Healing water that heals actor
HealthFountain
Health fountain containing healing water
HighGround
Abstract class for all highGround

Class that represents a weapon for an unarmed Actor (e.g.
InvincibleWalkAction
This class represents the action of Player walking over high grounds when Player has the INVINCIBLE effect

Abstract base class representing a physical object in the game world.

A menu GUI implementations
Monologue
Monologue class is a class that handle the speech text between Player and Toad

An Action that moves the Actor.
NonPlayerCharacter
Class representing NonPlayerCharacters (NPCs) who all have behaviours
NumberRange
A class that represents an array of sequential numbers.
ObtainBottleAction
Action for actor to obtain bottle from toad
PickUpCoinAction
Action to represent picking up Coin and add Coin's value to Player's wallet Actor doesn't actually put coin into inventory, instead it just adds the coin value into wallet balance

Action to allow items to be picked up.
PiranhaPlant
Class representing Piranha Plant
Player
Class representing the Player.
Player
Class representing the Player.
Player
Class representing the Player.
PowerFountain
Power fountain containing power water
PowerStar
Power Star which grants actor INVINCIBLE capability upon consumed INVINCIBLE actors would be healed by 200 HP, walk normally over high grounds Any high grounds being stepped on would be converted to Dirt and Coins would be dropped Actors would also receive no damage when attack and actors would be able to instantly kill enemies if actors didn't miss NOTE: In our implementation, players can't consume another Power Star if player still has INVINCIBLE effect
PowerWater
Power water that empowers actors' attacks
PrincessPeach
Class representing Princess Peach which can be interacted with Player to end the game
Printable
Things that are Printable can appear in the user interface and therefore can be represented by a character in the UI.
RefillBottleAction
Action to refill bottle with water from fountain
ResetAction
ResetAction is a class that triggers the reset implementation of all the resettable objects
ResetManager
A global Singleton manager that does soft-reset on the instances.
Resettable
Resettable for all resettable objects to implement
Sapling
A Sapling class which is the subclass of Tree It represents the second stage of Tree
Speakable
An interface that provides the capability of speaking
SpeakAction
SpeakAction class is to handle the speak action of the actors
SpeakBehaviour
A behaviour which will be provided to all the NonPlayerCharacter(NPC) so that the NPC can automatically speak (self-speaking)
SpitBehaviour  
Sprout
A Sapling class which is the subclass of Tree It represents the first stage of Tree
Status  
Status
Use this enum class to give `buff` or `debuff`.
Stick  
SuicideAction
Action to present the suicidal of NPCs
SuperMushroom
Super Mushroom which grants actor SUPER capability upon consumed SUPER actors' MAX HP would be increased by 50, display character would be changed to M Actors can also jump freely with 100% success rate and no fall damage NOTE: In our implementation, player's can't consume another Super Mushroom if player still has SUPER effect
TeleportAction
Action to let actor teleport from warp pipe in a map to the warp pipe of another map
Toad
A guy that stands in the middle, speaks to actor and sells item, Toad
TradeAction
TradeAction to buy item
Tree

Tree
Abstract class representing tree

Class representing action to be executed for Player to win the game

Wallet of actor tracking value of money the actor has

WanderBehaviour
Behaviour to allow enemy to wander around
WarpPipe
Warp pipe which spawns piranha plant, kill it to teleport here
Water
Water that can be consumed and brings magical effects

Interface for weapon items.

Class representing items that can be used as a weapon.
WindowSmashAction  
World
Class representing the game world, including the locations of all Actors, the player, and the playing grid.
Wrench
Wrench is a weapon item that can be bought from Toad that enables the actor to destroy Koopa's shell.
